724711f-a.text:
West Street, Morton to Barrow Street. (Before Reconstruction.)
President Borough of Manhattan.
June 24, 1918.
724711f-a.folder: West Street & Morton Street, Manhattan, NY

724712f-a.text:
West Street, Morton, to Barrow. (Before Reconstruction).

President Borough of Manhattan.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE.                 June 9, 1918.
724712f-a.folder: West Street & Morton Street, Manhattan, NY

721740f-a.text:
Morton Street, north side, east of and from West Street to and including Washington Street, showing the old one-story frame stable at 111 Morton Street, and the old Cyrus Rheims Stables at and adioining the N.W. corner of Washington Street. These will be demolished late in 1930 when the west side of Washington Street (q.v.) is cleared.
May 12, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.
721740f-a.folder: Morton Street & West Street, Manhattan, NY

724708f.text:
West Street, north from and including Pier 42 and Morton Street, the year before the first section of the West Side Elevated
Highway was built.
March 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
724708f.folder: West Street & Morton Street, Manhattan, NY

724709f-a.text:
Royal Mail Steam Packet Company, Pier 42, North River, West Street,
west side, opposite Morton Street.
March 8, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
